intro: Jurinea taraxacifolia, commonly known as the leafy绢花, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Jurinea taraxacifolia is adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems and reduced leaf surfaces to minimize water loss.
